title: MacOS Printer Workflow Send to Thnderbird
content:
On my previous Macbook, I had set up a printer workflow that let me attach a PDF to a new Thunderbird message. It worked the same way as Send to Mail, but started a new Thunderbird message. (Print > PDF > Send to Thunderbird.) I seem to recall doing something in Automator when I set it up years ago, but for the life of me, I can't remember what. That Macbook drowned in January and was unsalvageable, and that workflow which I used constantly, was lost.

I just spend two hours scouring the internet, both Thunderbird- and MacOS-related sites, with no luck. Yes, I know I can save to PDF and then add it to a new outgoing message, but I had it setup so I could do all of this in one step from the system print dialog, and I do this frequently enough that I really want that functionality back. It's not as simple as dragging Thunderbird.app into the PDF Services folder; I've tried that.

Does anybody have this working on their Mac?
creator: dascalargo

070rAPK0ghcXJy3ja8RCGJB8

Content-Type: text/plain; charset=UTF-8; format=flowed Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

AI deepfakes are a /massive/ problem for mischief and serious harm, not the least of which is this election season. Nearly /two-thirds/ of folks can’t tell the difference between AI-generated images and voices and the real thing. Scammers can put together a convincing image or video, but they can't fake the context. 


   When in doubt, use this AI image checklist

Election fakes are particularly tricky to spot because there’s so much public footage of politicians speaking in front of similar backgrounds to copy. But you can still use these guidelines to verify if it’s AI or not: 

 * *Backgrounds:* A vague, blurred background, smooth surfaces or lines    that don’t match up are immediate red flags that an image is    AI-generated. Also, use your head — if the scenery doesn’t align    with the current climate, season or what’s physically possible,    that’s because it’s fake.  * *Proportions:* Check for objects that look mushed together or seem    too large or small. The same goes for features, especially ears,    fingers and feet.  * *Text:* AI can’t spell. Look for fake/misspelled  words on signs    and labels.  * *Chins:* Yep, you heard me. The lower half of the face is the No. 1    giveaway on AI-generated candidate videos. It’s subtle, but check to    see if their chin or neck moves unnaturally or in an exaggerated way.  * *Fingers and hands:* Look for weird positions, too many fingers,    extra-long digits or hands out of place.
070rAPK0ghcXJy3ja8RCGJB8

Content-Type: text/html; charset=UTF-8 Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

<meta http-equiv="content-type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8"> <font size="5">AI deepfakes are a massive problem for mischief and serious harm, not the least of which is this election season.
</font><font size="5">Nearly two-thirds of folks can’t tell the difference between AI-generated images and voices and the real thing.
Scammers can put together a convincing image or video, but they can't fake the context.

</font>

When in doubt, use this AI image checklist

Election fakes are particularly tricky to spot because there’s so much public footage of politicians speaking in front of similar backgrounds to copy. But you can still use these guidelines to verify if it’s AI or not:

  • Backgrounds: A vague, blurred background, smooth surfaces or lines that don’t match up are immediate red flags that an image is AI-generated. Also, use your head — if the scenery doesn’t align with the current climate, season or what’s physically possible, that’s because it’s fake.
  • Proportions: Check for objects that look mushed together or seem too large or small. The same goes for features, especially ears, fingers and feet.
  • Text: AI can’t spell. Look for fake/misspelled words on signs and labels.
  • Chins: Yep, you heard me. The lower half of the face is the No. 1 giveaway on AI-generated candidate videos. It’s subtle, but check to see if their chin or neck moves unnaturally or in an exaggerated way.
  • Fingers and hands: Look for weird positions, too many fingers, extra-long digits or hands out of place.

070rAPK0ghcXJy3ja8RCGJB8--

title: gmail label
content: Thunderbird does not display the gmail tag. I have looked through the settings of gmail and thunderbird, but I have not found an answer.

title: Global search not working for a specific email
content: I have an email that is not indexed correctly and is not found using the global search. I have already deleted the global database and recreated the index. It's still not found searching by a simple word. What is the best way to submit a bug ticket?

title: incoming mail
content: In one of my three computers the e-mail does not work as it should. Incoming mail can be delayed by days, and now, weeks. Have tried uninstalling and reinstalling but all the old settings are included. What can I do, I am really bad at this? Ylva

title: Cartelle unificate e filtri messaggi non funziona
content:
Salve a tutti... vorrei un aiuto per risolvere un problema che sto notando . Ho la visualizzazione a cartelle unificate e due account gmail... Ho notato che quando avvio thunderbird, mi scarica tutte le mail nella cartella unificata posta in arrivo , anche quelle che tramite filtri dovrebbero andare direttamente nelle cartelle impostate nei filtri. Sempre dalla cartella posta in arrivo unificata se provo ad aprirla non si aprono. Ho sempre notato che nemmeno se provo a riscaricare i messaggi si aggiornano le mail andandosi a sistemare nelle proprie cartelle. L'unico modo per togliere le mail da posta in arrivo unificate e far in modo che vadano nelle cartelle dei filtri, è aprire la tendina dell'account che ha le mail con i filtri e cliccare sulla cartella dove dovrebbero andare . Io vorrei che avviato thunderbird nella cartella posta in arrivo unificata rimanessero solo le mail che non hanno filtri applicati. Non so se devo modificare qualche impostazione. Grazie in anticipo.

Davide
creator: davdo84

title: login to server smtp.office365.com with username failed when using mail merge in the latest thunderbird version
content:
Hey Guys! I am facing a very weird issue in Thunderbird since the last update, 115.9.0. I use the mail merge extension (10.4.0 latest version) for mass emailing. Since last update, I have gotten an error: "login to server smtp.office365.com with username failed" after 6-8 minutes of mail merge. After that, I popup a windows asking to retry, After hitting retry, the microsoft login window pops up and i need to enter password, which solves the issue. But again, after sending each email, I get the same error until I retry and login manually. This sometimes has a glitch on the Microsoft login page, and it fluctuates until the mail merge times out to block my emails permanently from Microsoft detecting them as suspicious login attempts.

This was completely fine in the previous thunderbird version. I have tried everything to fix the following to fix:- 1. I tried downgrading to the previous version of Thunderbird (which does fix the issue), but unfortunately my email ID gets blocked from sending emails from Microsoft. 2. Disabling the no authentication settings from outgoing server settings in Thunderbird did not help; still, the same issue. 3. Re-installing thunderbird and re-adding the emails - does not help again

Please can anyone help me debug this and find a solution?
creator: riteshm321

title: Can't send from Comcast

title: Thunderbird Version 115.9.0: Message Headers
